content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.
Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.
Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.
Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is a real number.

The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by the power series <math alttext="f of x equals, x minus the fraction x cubed over 3, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the fifth power, over 5, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the seventh power, over 7, end fraction, plus dot dot dot, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n power, times x raised to the 2 n plus 1, power, and denominator 2 n plus 1, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>7</mn></msup><mn>7</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>n</mi></msup><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></math> for all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which the series converges.

(a) Using the ratio test, find the interval of convergence of the power series for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.
Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.
Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.
Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> is a real number.

The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by the power series <math alttext="f of x equals, x minus the fraction x cubed over 3, end fraction, plus the fraction x to the fifth power, over 5, end fraction, minus the fraction x to the seventh power, over 7, end fraction, plus dot dot dot, plus the fraction with numerator, open parenthesis, negative 1, close parenthesis, raised to the n power, times x raised to the 2 n plus 1, power, and denominator 2 n plus 1, end fraction, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>7</mn></msup><mn>7</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>n</mi></msup><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></math> for all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which the series converges.

(a) Using the ratio test, find the interval of convergence of the power series for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

(b) Show that <math alttext="the absolute value of, f of one half, minus one half, end absolute value, is less than one tenth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>|</mo><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answer.

(c) Write the first four nonzero terms and the general term for an infinite series that represents <math alttext="f prime of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

(d) Use the result from part (c) to find the value of <math alttext="f prime of one sixth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
